page.title: 07EMPLOYMENT
page.content: There is little full time employment in the area. Although some farms are still worked most are owned by commuters who leave the land or work it as a small holding. Bed and breakfast and standing for caravans are available. All the inns provide bed and breakfast, meals and snacks. Milltown-Clay Cross Iron and Foundries Co. did mine fluorspar. Now the site is used for a floatation plant where fluorspar and barytes from elsewhere, including parts of Derbyshire, are brought in and processed. The minerals are then sold to other companies. Only a few people are employed at this plant. Some lead mines are still uncapped but no longer mined. There is a small complex comprising of a joinery, a building contrator and two subsidiaries. There are two garages. A local council tip employs one man.
